recommendations.low: Notice and name strengths in class; give roles that use those strengths (monitor, group leader).
recommendations.medium: Ask, 'What are you proud of this week?' and connect them to small success tasks; use growth-mindset language.
recommendations.high: Student often says 'I am useless / I can't do anything'; share concern with counselor; avoid harsh or public criticism and co-create a small success plan.

recommendations.low: Give challenging work with supportive feedback; use them as peer tutor occasionally.
recommendations.medium: Break tasks into smaller steps; praise effort and strategy, not marks; allow extra clarification time.
recommendations.high: Consistent avoidance, frequent 'I can't'; coordinate with parents and counselor for remedial support and exam accommodations; reduce public performance pressure.

recommendations.low: Keep them in mixed groups; reinforce inclusive behaviour.
recommendations.medium: Notice who they sit/work with; pair with kind peers; teach basic social skills in class (listening, 'I' statements).
recommendations.high: Frequent isolation, rejection, or clinginess; consult counselor; actively monitor group work and seating; avoid forcing public pairings with students who are unkind.

recommendations.low: Maintain open-door tone ('If you ever need to talk...'); keep promises.
recommendations.medium: Schedule brief 1:1 check-ins; explicitly invite questions; model non-judgmental listening.
recommendations.high: Student reports 'no adult I can trust'; inform counselor/mental-health lead; identify at least one adult and intentionally build that relationship.

recommendations.low: Normal ups and downs; continue warm interactions; mention wellness tools to whole class.
recommendations.medium: Quiet conversation ('You seem low lately – want to share?'); link them to coping resources and mood diary; monitor for 2–3 weeks.
recommendations.high: Persistent sadness, comments about hopelessness, big drop in functioning; inform counselor the same day; avoid statements that minimise feelings.

recommendations.low: One-off minor conflict; mediate respectfully; reinforce class rules on respect and inclusion.
recommendations.medium: Repeated unkind behaviour; document incidents; separate students when needed; inform parent and counselor; follow school anti-bullying policy.
recommendations.high: Ongoing bullying, threats, or severe humiliation; treat as safety issue; involve principal/counselor immediately; ensure student is supervised and feels safe.

recommendations.low: Listen calmly, thank the child for sharing if they mention something minor.
recommendations.medium: If concerns are ambiguous, consult counselor/child-protection lead the same day.
recommendations.high: Follow school child-protection protocol immediately; involve principal and designated officer; avoid sending child home without a plan.

recommendations.medium: Mention wellness resources; monitor closely and inform counselor if signs increase.
recommendations.high: Stay with student; do not leave them alone. Inform counselor/principal immediately; follow crisis protocol; remove academic pressure.

recommendations.low: General education to class about sleep; adjust homework load around big exams.
recommendations.medium: Talk privately; ask about routine; suggest sleep and digital-wellness resources; consider flexible deadlines.
recommendations.high: Severe fatigue; refer to counselor and suggest medical review via parents.

recommendations.low: In PTMs, praise effort to families; share realistic expectations.
recommendations.medium: Arrange calm parent meeting; explain impact of pressure; encourage supportive language at home.
recommendations.high: Coordinate with counselor to hold structured family meeting; if safety issues exist, follow protection pathway.

recommendations.low: Encourage goal-setting and celebrate small progress.
recommendations.medium: Discuss strengths and options; refer to career guidance or counselor.
recommendations.high: Urgent counselor referral; adjust expectations; increase check-ins.

recommendations.low: Model non-appearance-based praise; stop appearance-based teasing in class.
recommendations.medium: Gentle conversation; validate feelings; connect to counselor for body-image support.
recommendations.high: Extreme shame or social withdrawal; inform counselor and parents; recommend professional evaluation.

recommendations.low: Teach digital-wellness and cyberbullying lessons to whole class.
recommendations.medium: Set class rules for phone overuse; talk with parents about phone timing.
recommendations.high: Online harassment or exposure to harmful content; involve counselor and parents; follow cyber-safety policy.

recommendations.low: Classroom lessons on assertiveness and saying 'no'.
recommendations.medium: Explore pressures in a private talk; rehearse responses; consider shifting groups.
recommendations.high: Peer pressure linked to substance use or sexual risk; immediate referral to counselor; close monitoring.

recommendations.low: Normal nervousness; teach study skills and relaxation.
recommendations.medium: Individual check-in; offer structured revision plans; coordinate with parents to lower pressure.
recommendations.high: Panic attacks or refusal to attend; counselor involvement; consider special arrangements (extra time).

recommendations.low: Offer projects where students explore strengths and values.
recommendations.medium: Listen without judgment; normalise that identity is evolving; link to growth-mindset resources.
recommendations.high: Identity confusion plus bullying or rejection; coordinate with counselor for careful support.

recommendations.low: Give factual information about options and multiple pathways.
recommendations.medium: Refer to career guidance or counselor; involve parents in realistic planning.
recommendations.high: Career anxiety tied to severe stress; urgent meeting with counselor and parents.

recommendations.low: Introduce balanced routines, breaks, movement in class.
recommendations.medium: Talk about workload; help prioritise; encourage use of stress-management resources.
recommendations.high: Refer to counselor; consider timetable adjustments or temporary reduction in demands.

recommendations.low: Accept occasional complaints; check hydration and breaks.
recommendations.medium: Notice patterns; talk kindly; suggest doctor visit; use stress-management tools.
recommendations.high: Persistent complaints tied to anxiety/school refusal; refer to counselor and medical professional.
